intro: Hesperantha trifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved starflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets, which is a distinctive botanical feature. Hesperantha trifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
